torch_connectomics.model¶

Contents

  • Building Blocks
  • Model Zoo

Building Blocks¶

class residual_block_2d(in_planes, out_planes, projection=True)[source]¶

Residual Block 2D

Parameters:
  • in_planes (int) – number of input channels.
  • out_planes (int) – number of output channels.
  • projection (bool) – projection of the input with a conv layer.
class residual_block_3d(in_planes, out_planes, projection=False)[source]¶

Residual Block 3D

Parameters:
  • in_planes (int) – number of input channels.
  • out_planes (int) – number of output channels.
  • projection (bool) – projection of the input with a conv layer.
class bottleneck_dilated_2d(in_planes, out_planes, projection=False, dilate=2)[source]¶

Bottleneck Residual Block 2D with Dilated Convolution

Parameters:
  • in_planes (int) – number of input channels.
  • out_planes (int) – number of output channels.
  • projection (bool) – projection of the input with a conv layer.
  • dilate (int) – dilation rate of conv filters.
class bottleneck_dilated_3d(in_planes, out_planes, projection=False, dilate=2)[source]¶

Bottleneck Residual Block 3D with Dilated Convolution

Parameters:
  • in_planes (int) – number of input channels.
  • out_planes (int) – number of output channels.
  • projection (bool) – projection of the input with a conv layer.
  • dilate (int) – dilation rate of conv filters.
class dilated_fusion_block(in_planes, out_planes, channel_reduction=16, spatial_reduction=2, z_reduction=1)[source]¶

Dilated Conv & Fusion Block

Parameters:
  • in_planes (int) – number of input channels.
  • out_planes (int) – number of output channels.
  • channel_reduction (int) – channel squeezing factor.
  • spatial_reduction (int) – pooling factor for x,y axes.
  • z_reduction (int) – pooling factor for z axis.
class squeeze_excitation_2d(channel, channel_reduction=4, spatial_reduction=4)[source]¶

Squeeze-and-Excitation Block 2D

Parameters:
  • channel (int) – number of input channels.
  • channel_reduction (int) – channel squeezing factor.
  • spatial_reduction (int) – pooling factor for x,y axes.
class squeeze_excitation_3d(channel, channel_reduction=4, spatial_reduction=4, z_reduction=1)[source]¶

Squeeze-and-Excitation Block 3D

Parameters:
  • channel (int) – number of input channels.
  • channel_reduction (int) – channel squeezing factor.
  • spatial_reduction (int) – pooling factor for x,y axes.
  • z_reduction (int) – pooling factor for z axis.

Model Zoo¶

class unetv0(in_channel=1, out_channel=3, filters=[32, 64, 128, 256, 256], act='sigmoid')[source]¶

U-net with residual blocks.

Parameters:
  • in_channel (int) – number of input channels.
  • out_channel (int) – number of output channels.
  • filters (list) – number of filters at each u-net stage.
class unetv3(in_channel=1, out_channel=3, filters=[28, 36, 48, 64, 80])[source]¶

Lightweight U-net with residual blocks (based on [Lee2017] with modifications).

[Lee2017]Lee, Kisuk, Jonathan Zung, Peter Li, Viren Jain, and H. Sebastian Seung. “Superhuman accuracy on the SNEMI3D connectomics challenge.” arXiv preprint arXiv:1706.00120, 2017.
Parameters:
  • in_channel (int) – number of input channels.
  • out_channel (int) – number of output channels.
  • filters (list) – number of filters at each u-net stage.
